main event: A civilian observed an unidentified aerial object that initially appeared as a meteor but then seemed to transform into a flaming object in the sky in Lark, Utah on October 17, 1950.
interesting points: The object was first described as a long, thin line of fire crossing the sky., The observer thought it was a meteor before realizing it was something else., The object displayed unusual movement, breaking away and shooting in an opposite direction., The sighting lasted around 2 to 3 seconds., The information was reported to the 115th CIC Detachment due to the observer's uncertainty about which agency to contact.
sighted object: a flaming object in the sky
witness description: A compressor operator and a companion working on the Lark Tunnel
